intro: Lannea edulis var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth-barked lannea, is a shrub or small tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Anacardiaceae, which includes cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its smooth, greyish bark and simple, alternate leaves. It produces small, yellowish flowers followed by edible, fleshy fruits that are consumed by various wildlife. This species is adapted to dry and semi-arid environments, making it an important component of local ecosystems.
